content.text:
Hands-free driving laws are going into effect across the United States and some states will be banning cell-phone use while driving completely. Long time hands-free laws have been in effect for years in states such as New York, New Jersey, Washington D.C. and Connecticut.

California has 2 new driving laws going into effect on July 1st, 2008 one of the laws (SB1613) allows a driver to use a cell-phone if there is a hands-free device used. The other California driving law (SB33) bans drivers under the age of 18 from using any type of wireless device in a moving vehicle.

In Washington State, (ESSB 5037) requires drivers to use hands-free devices when talking on their cell phones starting July 1, 2008 and (EHB1214) bans text messaging while driving on January 1st, 2008.

Hands-free devices include Bluetooth headsets, wired headsets and car kits. Your cellular phone must be Bluetooth compatible to use with a Bluetooth device. Wired headsets only require a head phone connection with your cellular device and provide a cost effective way to become hands-free.
